website_summaries.verdict: Realistic duck training dummy effectively teaches dogs how to gently retrieve animals.
pros: A variety of bird designs to choose from
Soft foam materials encourage a light mouth grip and allow you to inject scents into the bird
Swinging head and detailed body give a realistic look
cons: Rope handle is on the thin side, making it difficult to grip

customer_reviews.title: The dog loves it and I love the results from using it!
customer_reviews.text: This dummy has greatly improved not only my pups form, but also his desire to retrieve. He still tries to pick it up in weird ways but quickly changes his mind when carrying it for longer distances. Over all, this dummy has helped us advanced in our training and I will be buying another one when/if this one dies. So far, it has been used very frequently and shows no damage so maybe it's more likely that we'll lose it..
customer_reviews.author: Vizsla Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Smaller Mouthed Dog
customer_reviews.text: Our pointer was the runt of the litter and she has trouble retrieving the full sized duck dummy since she can't get the body in her mouth. This is a perfect size for her. She loves it! People always comment that they've never seen a pointer retrieve like she does. She just loves her duck dummy.
customer_reviews.author: Deer HunterTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Beware this item is a "Miniature Mallard" do not confuse for the Full-Sized Dokken Mallard
customer_reviews.text: These are solid retrievers. This was ordered without noting it is a "MINIATURE MALLARD". I will use it along with my collection of FULL SIZED retrievers to add a bit of variety. But this miniature trainer is only a few dollars less than the full-sized, so I honestly question the overall value of such a purchase. I will add that I HIGHLY recommend the full-sized retrievers for labradors. Best of luck in the field and on the water!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Extremely lifelike. I got to see it in action and was really neat.
customer_reviews.text: Way cool! Purchased for a friend but got to see in action and was surprised by how life like It is. Got to see it retrieved by a dog which was fascinating. Will be used in training and should be a great aid. She was thrilled and will be ordering several of the other models.
customer_reviews.author: Magic

customer_reviews.title: Great Training Dummy!
customer_reviews.text: This training dummy is durable. It also seems to retain scent, so when I throw it into deep woods or dense thickets, my dog finds it faster than other items thrown.
customer_reviews.author: JG Yahtzee

customer_reviews.title: Your labs will love this one
customer_reviews.text: My two black labs absolutely love this toy. I only bring it out one a day for a few retrieves. But they know what it is and what it means. I don't let them chew on it. I only send them for 2 or 3 retrieves each in one day. Then I put it away. So far, it is 100% in tact. If you want to implement something to get a better grip for throwing the dummy father, then use a 1/2 inch PVC cap at HD. It costs $0.50. Drill a hole in it. Run the rope through it. Put a washer on the inside. Tie a knot. It works wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S. Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Good Dog Trainer for Upland Hunting
customer_reviews.text: Good, realistic product for birddog training. It has a bit of a manufacturing smell to it. There's good instructions over at Gun Dog Supply for getting rid of that smell. The tail is made out of plastic and held on by the cord. It gives the sense of a real tail feather. The power throw ball for the rope is helpful when you want to get further distance out of your throws. It's silly that they don't just put them on to begin with. I'd definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: A must have for dog training
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product ! My 11 week old german shorthaired pointer Reba needed no enticing when I opened this box in front of her. I combined this dummy w pheasant scent, teased her w it a little and threw it about 30 yards into the wind and she took off like a rocket after it. It's got a real good weight to it for throwing. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Cote

customer_reviews.title: Smaller size
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my dog’s tenth birthday, Black Lab, and it appears to be made well and colors are excellent, even a metal band, like tagged, on a real duck !! Disappointed in the size, as it’s smaller than expected and or advertised. Used it for the first time yesterday, dog loves it !
customer_reviews.author: KymW

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Golden who swims with his duck all the live long day- and night if I would let him. It has a good feel to it and given my dog’s soft mouth there isn’t a mark on it. The separate head makes it more life-like and the string can be used to engage your dog—
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cool idea... not the best execution. Still it is what is.
customer_reviews.text: Nice training tool. The cord on this is glued at the neck and the tail and does not include a throw knob at the end of the cord. The cord seems a little more rigid than the duck and the quality of this one is a little less. Texture is a little odd too. Not sure if all of this is on purpose. I got the duck first and I guess my expectations were the same for the dove. Still works well.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Kowalski

customer_reviews.title: More durable than I thought.
customer_reviews.text: My labradoodle is tough on retrieving dummies. My first thought was, “this one will never last”. I don’t think that now. Have thrown hundreds of times an doesn’t show a scratch. Love the way the shape encourages and really forces the dog to grabe the birds body. Great for training.
customer_reviews.author: John Topham

customer_reviews.title: Puppie (Weimeraner) loved this product. Great for fetch training.
customer_reviews.text: Great size and weight. Really like the tail feathers. Feet could be improved but not bad. Length of pull rope could be longer and have a larger knot or ball on the end to make throwing easier and to make it possible to throw it further.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Realistic Weight - Very Durable
customer_reviews.text: This dummy is durable. My bird dog and I do multiple retrieves with it every day and it’s stayed true to its durability, size, shape, and color. I’ve had the dummy in all kinds of cover and in water with no problem at all. Very realistic weight. It’s been worth every cent.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Mattson

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for simply retrieving from water
customer_reviews.text: Trained by Border Collie how to fetch from the water with this. She used to be terrified of swimming but this helped her learn. She’s not a waterfowl retriever by any means, but even she has figured out that it’s most efficient to grasp the bird around its neck. Highly recommend for recreational purposes, too!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Koch

customer_reviews.title: Dog LOVES this goose
customer_reviews.text: My dog absolutely loves this goose, couldn't get enough. If you want to toss a goose into the water 100000000 times and have your pup retrieve it with as much gusto as the very first time, then this goose is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Cabell

customer_reviews.title: Size of a teal
customer_reviews.text: Guess I should've read the description. This is the size of a teal. Why make a mallard dummy the size of a teal? To a dog a small duck is a small duck a big duck is a big duck. Colors dont mean squat.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Newzell

customer_reviews.title: My Lab loves this
customer_reviews.text: My Lab goes crazy over this and it’s an awesome trainer for her for retrieving. One of the legs broke off after the first throw but it doesn’t hamper the her interest in this. I plan to buy a second one to keep it in my car for pre-hunt excitement.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Great for water retrieving!
customer_reviews.text: This is my GSP's favorite retrieving toy! We only use it for supervised fetch in the pond and pool, as he would tear it up otherwise, though it is very durable, but meant as a training device. It's super east to throw, and I use it when we do dock diving as it makes him jump farther!
customer_reviews.author: betsey knight

customer_reviews.title: Great retrieving toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my medium sized labradoodle (33 lbs) who has very strong retrieving drive. She loves it! I like to change up what retrieving toys we use when playing fetch so this one is in frequent rotation. My new Water dog also likes it. Since both of my dogs on the smaller size this product is great for them. I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TRAINING DUMMY!
customer_reviews.text: Do you pheasant hunt? Do you hunt over a dog? If you do, you need this dummy as a training tool. Simple as that!
customer_reviews.author: Old Duffer

customer_reviews.title: Very good!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband to use for training our dog- our old one was junk. This one is way better and more realistic looking! My husband is very satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: For lab puppy training
customer_reviews.text: For training 11 month old lab. He is still shaking bird, but I know he has a soft mouth so for me no worries. (he picks up our chickens and carries them around all the time- they don't seem to care) Throws easily and farther than cloth decoys.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.... Besides the faulty legs
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the product works great as a training dummy. My dog loves it and it throws nicely. My only criticism is that the leg broke off on only the second throw. It would seem more sensible to make the legs out of a more flexible material than hard plastic considering the product is meant to be thrown into the air and dropped over and over. If the leg issue was resolved, I would buy every pattern available. Great product... besides the faulty legs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product seems durable.
customer_reviews.text: It’s durable. I’ve been using it about every other day for the last two months. Throwing it for retrieval. I’ve also been injecting scent into it and hiding the dummy for retrieving. It’s holding up well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher T Jones

customer_reviews.title: Lab
customer_reviews.text: This particular trainer is heavy and a little hard to throw. Needs a ball or something on the end of cord to assist in throwing. Not my favorite trainer but well made.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted. Realistic looking, small, perfect to start training our hunting puppy. And my son is going to use it for part of his bird hunting Halloween costume first. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Lifelike
customer_reviews.text: Really great quality and solid. It heavy like a large pheasant. It’s an excellent trading tool for my German Shorthair Pointer. He goes wild when he sees it!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Best ever—Happy Dance
customer_reviews.text: Lily dancing with excitement for her new favorite toy! I’ve never seen her so excited, and she carries it so proudly!!! Clearly, retrieving a dead mallard is in her DNA!
customer_reviews.author: Sasha

customer_reviews.title: Works great, looks good
customer_reviews.text: Works great, looks good, our eight-month-old lab loves retrieving it. The body is rubberized foam and the head is hard plastic so she learned pretty quickly to grab the body and not to shake it. Only knock I have is that the knot on the rope that you toss with is small and can be tough to grip/really get good leverage to throw it far, but other than that, it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B

customer_reviews.title: Great training tool
customer_reviews.text: Rugged foam body and performs as needed. Could be damaged if dog is left to chew on it with out supervision. Quality training dummy.
customer_reviews.author: Jen B

customer_reviews.title: My Dog's Favorite Toy
customer_reviews.text: I know this is meant to be a hunting/training tool, but this is my dog's favorite toy, its a deal breaker, we never go hiking without it, she carries it like her security blanket. Love it, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: SL Cloutier

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Dog uses all the time. She has a soft pallet so stays together. Only concern is where string and bumper meet as this is getting frayed and will be unhappy if or when string breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonerific

customer_reviews.title: Durable Tool
customer_reviews.text: Training tool for sons dog. Has lasted over a year!!
customer_reviews.author: EW

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this trainer. I just think she shouldn't be able to tear into it as easily she has.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Holmes

customer_reviews.title: The body is very duck like in weight and feel
customer_reviews.text: My Labrador loved it , but she has to be watched with it or she will chew on the feet.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Lyons Laskey

customer_reviews.title: Is this a joke?
customer_reviews.text: Those idiots sent a mini effing duck like I’m going to be hunting midgets
customer_reviews.author: caden

customer_reviews.title: ... smaller than I expected and the dog did not like it. I ended up ordering the plain white ...
customer_reviews.text: This decoy is smaller than I expected and the dog did not like it. I ended up ordering the plain white rubber decoy and the dog loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Coker

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last
customer_reviews.text: Left it in yard by mistake and a 4 month old GSP chewed it’s head off, throwing rope and trail off in one day
customer_reviews.author: dianna d.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and weight for our 5 month old black lab puppy.
customer_reviews.text: Pup will be a hunter, this is for fetching practice and fun. She loves it it's perfect. We only let her play with it for fetch and she adores it.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Great training dummy
customer_reviews.text: Love this dummy. Seemed the dog was getting a bored of the regular style dummy and when I get this one out the dog gets all excited.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: These are quality dummies. I've purchased several in the last 16 years. Great training tool and the dove is perfect size for a young lab. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get this for your puppy for imprinting
customer_reviews.text: If you're into duck hunting and you are training your puppy this is the item that you should start with excellent not too hard dogs love it enjoy
customer_reviews.author: Mr.fade

customer_reviews.title: Same as mini-mallard except head color, but $ 2.50 less--good puppy trainer; spraypaint feet yellow like they used to be.
customer_reviews.text: Nice Starter for pups, close to true size; good price compared to mini-mallard which is exactly the same except color; don't know why they leave feet white. These used to include power ball. Detail a few years ago was better.
customer_reviews.author: smike

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Works great to train the dogs. Great quality! Came before it said it would come which is a plus in my book! Another item where the price is better than a store.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for training or play
customer_reviews.text: Got one for my golden doodle to play in the pool with. They absolutely love it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Pick

customer_reviews.title: Great but bigger than expected
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Too big for my 12 week Springer Spaniel, but it will be perfect eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Honesty

customer_reviews.title: Great gift idea for any retriever
customer_reviews.text: Dog loves this, lasts long, closed cell foam works great in the water. Life like feel. Money well spent, just make sure you get the right size fowl for the size of the dog.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: 7 WEEK AMERICAN BLACK LAB LOVES HIS DUCKY
customer_reviews.text: Great lifelike product meant for hunting and retriever training. This is not a toy to chew on, rather a training device. Get this for your puppy you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: FLIGHT 2324

customer_reviews.title: Golden Duck Dummy
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made and perfect for a " soft mouth" breed, like my Golden Retriever. Unfortunately, a large breed stole it at the pool and the body has large chunks missing from its belly. That only lasted about a minute.
customer_reviews.author: robert brown

customer_reviews.title: Great Training Dummy
customer_reviews.text: Durable, easy to throw, and my dog loves it. This was the first training dummy I've bought for my bird dog. It's been a great tool to help with training.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I have had this mallard for about 3 months now and train my dog on a daily basis. Still going strong. I use it on both water and land. Tends to retain a little water but u can easily squeeze it out! Overall extremely happy
customer_reviews.author: Joey E.

customer_reviews.title: Great size for my 2 month old black lab
customer_reviews.text: Great size for my 2 month old black lab. He loves it. It's the same size as their teal version. The hard head teaches the dog to not shake the bird or bite the head. A big agressive dog got ahold of it for 30 minutes and minimum damage was done. Perfect bumper. Will buy a bigger one when he gets bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Will B.

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves it. Goes bonkers when I get it out for him to fetch.
customer_reviews.author: JAReview

customer_reviews.title: Create retriever trainer tool
customer_reviews.text: Working with a lab puppy and decoy helps with teaching soft mouth and not to shake the bird.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: I use this to switch up the training for my chocolate lab. Dokken does make some really good decoys and they hold up quite well. They do have the injection scents for this decoy and they greatly enhance the training for the dogs. The scents do not have the needles to inject the scent in the decoy.
customer_reviews.author: Eod_machine

customer_reviews.title: The Vizslas' love it. Fairly sturdy rugged
customer_reviews.text: The Vizslas' love it. Fairly sturdy rugged. Has lasted almost a month – that's a record for those girls. Dokken makes good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID

customer_reviews.title: Great training tool!!
customer_reviews.text: Have a 4 month old lab pup on the smaller side (26lbs) seems to have no trouble picking it up and running. Teaches her the proper way to hold a bird!
customer_reviews.author: DTails

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our lab
customer_reviews.text: Love these products for our lab. I do wish a grip was on the string to help throw it, but it is her favorite "toy" of all time. They are necessities for us!
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: Durable.  Seems to be well made. Lucy loves it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a durable product and my retriever loves it.
customer_reviews.author: WILL DEATON

customer_reviews.title: Great training bumper
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great bumper for our lab super happy with it and price !
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Wamsley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Even though my Labrador isn't a duck hunter, he will retrieve this anywhere-its in his blood.
customer_reviews.author: chris c sirignano

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for something to work on retrieving skills and this did the trick. He loves to fetch it and decided he needed to carry it to and from the dog park the first time we brought it out. Have never seen him so keen to play with anything else.
customer_reviews.author: NoBS

customer_reviews.title: My dog chewed the metal tail bit by bit and ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog chewed the metal tail bit by bit and swallowed it. Also to big and hard for her mouth.
customer_reviews.author: twinkiltoes

customer_reviews.title: Works great wish it was cheaper
customer_reviews.text: Love this product...great quality looks real and the dog loves it.....wish it wasnt so high priced so I could buy 3 or 4 of them
customer_reviews.author: Tim Richard

customer_reviews.title: Rubber broke off, string broke off and it essentially ...
customer_reviews.text: Rubber broke off, string broke off and it essentially was ruined within 20/30 mins with dog. Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Hornyak

customer_reviews.title: Great trainer, good quality
customer_reviews.text: Dog loves it, not something can use as a traditional toy, definitely for training only.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Came right on time and was exactly what I expected!
customer_reviews.author: debrosenlof

customer_reviews.title: Tampered item
customer_reviews.text: Why are my packages always open when i get them? Somebody is looking through my stuff. Please investigate
customer_reviews.author: David Estes

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done , needs something at the end of the rope to get a better grip for throwing
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: One of the legs came off right away. On the plus side, the hard feet and hard loose head prevented her from ever again shaking a bird!
customer_reviews.author: todd clay

customer_reviews.title: Dog is obsessed with it
customer_reviews.text: The best gift I gave this Christmas. Literally he carries it everywhere, haven't seen him without it since I gave it to him! 😍
customer_reviews.author: Paige Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great training dummies !
customer_reviews.text: As advertised and on time. DoKKen ducks and doves continue to be as close to the real thing for training as there is in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is very sturdy. It works well on land and on the ...
customer_reviews.text: We use this to play fetch with our dog (lab) almost every day. It is very sturdy. It works well on land and on the water. We also have the duck.
customer_reviews.author: Christina K

customer_reviews.title: Good for training
customer_reviews.text: This is good for training the dog for pheasant. I rub pheasant stick on it and I attached a wing to the tail so it would be more realistic.
customer_reviews.author: GREGORY BOGLE

customer_reviews.title: Great, but it’s not kidding when it says miniature
customer_reviews.text: Great, but it’s not kidding when it says miniature. Should have read further. Still works great for training, just not a realistic size. Would be great for pups.
customer_reviews.author: MA

customer_reviews.title: Luna Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: Great for throwing on land or in water! Floats well and seems durable so far. Our curly coated retriever Luna gets excited whenever we bring it out.
customer_reviews.author: Paul W. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: The Dokken Dove are great to use
customer_reviews.text: The Dokken Dove are great to use. You can use dove scent with then and I got threw 6 a year training my Boykin Spaniel Grace. Great bird hunting.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Young

customer_reviews.title: Dog loved!
customer_reviews.text: Having a hyper dog finding a fetch toy to keep his interest when at the lake is a must. He loved fetching this.
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: Great product for training
customer_reviews.text: Great product and design. You can throw this product very far. The only reason I am not giving this 5 stars is because of one small complaint. The product comes with a metal band around one of the duck feet that has the Dokken name on it, and it had a sharp edge on it that cut my dog's mouth. I immediately just removed the band with pliers and the problem was fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Dogs like things that you throw...
customer_reviews.text: Dog likes it, hasn’t ripped it to shreds after a few uses so I have no complaints
customer_reviews.author: Jean-Luc Durantaye

customer_reviews.title: Duck
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than expected but easy to throw, seems durable so far
customer_reviews.author: deanna

customer_reviews.title: My Boykin loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Great training tool and just fun for a dog to retrieve.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth L.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great training tool for my puppies and my boyfriend to help train them
customer_reviews.author: Celestalchick05

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My chocolate lab and two gsp's love it great training tool! Highly recomend!
customer_reviews.author: Chad wrangler15

customer_reviews.title: Not to bad.
customer_reviews.text: The product is loosing the painted design. It does throw and float nice. But overall for the money I thought it would hold up better. Only has been used three times.
customer_reviews.author: Azup

customer_reviews.title: Good quality item.
customer_reviews.text: Product is as described. I’m looking forward to using it when my puppy gets a bit older.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Lark

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and great training tool
customer_reviews.text: This pheasant dummy is great for training. Similar enough to a pheasant and it's virtually unbreakable!
customer_reviews.author: lgj5020

customer_reviews.title: Great but expensive
customer_reviews.text: These are great. This replaced a duck I had for years.
customer_reviews.author: L. thompson

customer_reviews.title: Almost life size
customer_reviews.text: Very similar to a real pheasant . After a couple hundred throws the head will break off
customer_reviews.author: Tim Simenson

customer_reviews.title: It's lasted great with the exception of the cord which has required ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this dummy with my 3.5 year old lab since she was weened. It's lasted great with the exception of the cord which has required some work.
customer_reviews.author: James Maddison

customer_reviews.title: ... the “miniature” in the description but it’s still a great product. I later ordered the full size but ...
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t pay attention to the “miniature” in the description but it’s still a great product. I later ordered the full size but I still use the miniature too.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Farias

customer_reviews.title: Toughest Training Dummy there is!!!
customer_reviews.text: Built tough to last forever. Have tossed and beatup many times so far and still looks new. I love how the only soft spot there is on the body makes your dog correctly grab that part for proper retrieval. Would recommend to any hunting enthusiest.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W. White

customer_reviews.title: Could be better....
customer_reviews.text: Ok don't use in or around water. Once it gets wet, in a matter of days it smells of mold and mildew. Otherwise dog loves it..
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: This is a great training tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great training tool. My chocolate lab is 6 mo. old and a crazy chewer. He hasn't been able to chew this apart. With all the parts on the bird made of hard plastic except the body, it has forced him to grab it there. He always seems to find it when I hide it in bushes too. I didn't even buy the injectable scent yet.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Kosmann

customer_reviews.title: It was a replacement of an older version of the ...
customer_reviews.text: It was a replacement of an older version of the same decoy for my brothers dog! It was a hit!!
customer_reviews.author: shawn w

customer_reviews.title: Great for training
customer_reviews.text: Really great for training! Puppies can chew through it though. Otherwise, quite durable.
customer_reviews.author: Aoife Bergin

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: My dog said it is life like and fun to retrieve.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Looked at multiple brands and chose this one. Very durable and lifelike.
customer_reviews.author: Chris G.

customer_reviews.title: great teaching aid
customer_reviews.text: the way the body is shaped, teaches the dog on the proper way to grasp.
customer_reviews.author: scot

product_meta.title: Dokken Dead Fowl Trainer Hunting Dog Dummy
product_meta.description: The bodies are made of a soft natural-feel foam with free swinging hard plastic head and feet and a natural dead bird weight. Encourages a proper pick up and hold while discouraging the shaking of birds. Dokken Dead Fowl Trainers float even when punctured and training scents may be injected directly into the body for added realism.
